title: Has Georgia enacted a law imposing severe criminal penalties for abortions and marriages?
subtitle: The House of Representatives Bill 481, which was signed into law in May 2019, led to a wave of assurances about its possible effects.
author: Dan MacGuill
vclaim: When implemented, the draft Law on the House of Representatives of Georgia 481 would leave women vulnerable to prosecution for criminal abortion, murder or second degree murder for abortion or abortion.
